page.title: 16CHANGES IN NESSCLIFFE
page.content: In the late l92Os, early 3Os, the village of Nesscliffe was very much as it is today, in the structural sense, other than a couple of new houses and the council estate, The Crescent, built on the edge of the village. The garage has been moved, it was on the bend opposite the Nesscliffe Hotel. By the Hotel, on what is now a car park, were 4 or 5 stables, these had been used in the earlier years for the travellers' horses. The Blacksmith's Shop was always a very busy place with farmers taking their horses to be shod. You could always hear the sound of the hammer hitting the anvil as Mr Jones made and fitted the horses shoes. The old school was heated by two coal fires in winter and at ll.5O each day a large kettle was put on one to make hot drinks of cocoa or oxo the children had brought with them.
